GLOBAL:SOFAConventions: Conventions for IRs with a 1-to-1 correspondence between emitter and receiver. The main application for this convention is to store headphone IRs recorded for each emitter and each ear.
GLOBAL:License: No license provided, ask the author for permission
GLOBAL:RoomType: Room type is not relevant here
GLOBAL:Title: m
attribute
SourcePosition: Default: Headphones are located at the position of the listener
EmitterPosition: Default: Reflects the correspondence of each emitter to each receiver
GLOBAL:ListenerShortName: Correspondence to a subject from the database
GLOBAL:ListenerDescription: Narrative description of the listener (or mannequin)
SourceManufacturer: Optional M-dependent version of the attribute SourceManufucturer
GLOBAL:SourceModel: Name of the headphone model. Must uniquely describe the headphones of the manufacturer
SourceModel: Optional M-dependent version of the attribute SourceModel
ReceiverDescription: Optional M-dependent version of the attribute ReceiverDescription
GLOBAL:EmitterDescription: Narrative description of the headphone drivers
EmitterDescription: Optional M-dependent version of the attribute EmitterDescription
MeasurementDate: Optional M-dependent date and time of the measurement
